intro: Distylium annamicum, commonly known as the Annamite mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees such as figs and mangroves. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered in small inflorescences. Its fruits are fleshy berries that contain seeds dispersed by birds. Due to its specialized ecological role, it plays an important part in the biodiversity of its native forest ecosystems.
